intro: Trigonella corniculata subsp. balansae, commonly known as the Balansae chickpea, is a flowering plant species native to certain regions of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces pods containing small, edible seeds that are similar to those of other Trigonella species. It is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and agricultural studies.
